_description: William Dunbar, ‘The twa cummeris’ — six 5-line stanzas with refrain

CULLl510.First Lines:
Airlie on as woddinsdayat þe wyne sat cummeris
                    tway…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Bot than to mend þai had guid hopThat Lentrand sould not
                    mak þame leine

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Airlie on als wodinsdayat þe wyne sat cumeris
                    tway…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…bot thane to mend tha had gud hopThat lentrune swld nocht mak
                    thame lene
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Pinkerton,  John,
                        ed.  
             Ancient Scottish Poems Never Before in Print.
         2 vols. London and Edinburgh, 1786: 1.113-14.
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.64-5.

AbeSeis2.First Lines:
Richt arly onn ask wednisdaydrinkande þe wyne sat cummaris
                    twa…
AbeSeis2.Last Lines:
…be þane to mend þai had gude hopeThat lange lentrin
                    suld nocht mak þaim leen
AbeSeis2.Editions:
Small,  John, Ae. James George Mackay,  George Powell McNeill,   and  Walter Gregor, eds.  
             The Poems of William Dunbar.
             5 pts. 
             Scottish Text Society
         2, 4, 16, 21, 29. Edinburgh, 1884-93: 3.249-50.

Banna.First Lines:
Rycht airlie on ask weddinsdayDrynkand the wyne satt cumeris
                    tway…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Be than to mend thay had gud howpThis lang lentroun makis me
                    lene
